goals.question: What is the distribution of BMI among the population?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of BMI values among the population and identify any potential outliers.

goals.question: What is the correlation between BMI and physical activity?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of BMI vs Physical Activity
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the relationship between BMI and physical activity levels and identify any potential trends or patterns.

goals.question: What is the distribution of obesity levels among different age groups?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of Obesity levels by Age Group
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the prevalence of obesity among different age groups and identify any potential age-related trends.

goals.question: What is the distribution of obesity levels among different countries?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of Obesity levels by Country
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the prevalence of obesity among different countries and identify any potential geographic trends.

goals.question: What is the relationship between BMI and obesity levels?
goals.visualization: Box plot of BMI by Obesity Level
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of BMI values among different obesity levels and identify any potential differences or similarities.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='BMI', bins=30, color='blue', kde=True)
    plt.axvline(data['BMI'].median(), color='red', linestyle='--', label=f"Median: {data['BMI'].median():.2f}")
    plt.title("What is the distribution of BMI among the population?", wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel("BMI")
    plt.ylabel("Frequency")
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    scatter = ax.scatter(data['BMI'], data['Physical_Activity'])
    ax.set_xlabel('BMI')
    ax.set_ylabel('Physical Activity')
    plt.title('What is the correlation between BMI and physical activity?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    age_groups = data['age_group'].unique()
    obesity_levels = data.groupby('age_group')['obesity_level'].mean()
    
    plt.bar(age_groups, obesity_levels)
    plt.xlabel('Age Group')
    plt.ylabel('Average Obesity Level')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of obesity levels among different age groups?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.legend(['Average Obesity Level'])
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.sort_values(by='obesity', ascending=False)
    plt.figure(figsize=(15, 6))
    plt.bar(data['country'], data['obesity'], color='blue')
    plt.xlabel('Country')
    plt.ylabel('Obesity Level')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of obesity levels among different countries?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    plt.legend(['Obesity Level'])
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    sns.boxplot(x='Obesity_Level', y='BMI', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between BMI and obesity levels?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Obesity Level')
    plt.ylabel('BMI')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.legend(title='Obesity Levels', loc='upper right')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
